sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A discription of Nortons falcehod of Yorke shyre, and of his fatall farewel The fatal fine of traitours loe: by iustice due, deseruyng soe. Gibson, William, ballad writer.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
By Alexander Lacie, for Henrie Kyrkeham, dwellyng at the signe of the blacke Boye, at the middle north dore of Paules church, Imprinted at London : [1570]
Signed: q[uod] William Gibson. Verse - "Of late (alas) the great vntruth". Publication date from STC. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Mutilated.
=======
A discription of Nortons falcehod of Yorke shyre, and of his fatall farewel The fatal fine of traitours loe: by iustice due, deseruyng soe. Gibson, William, ballad writer.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
By Alexander Lacie, for Henrie Kyrkeham, dwellyng at the signe of the blacke Boye, at the middle north dore of Paules church, Imprinted at London : [1570]
Signed: q[uod] William Gibson. Verse - "Of late (alas) the great vntruth". Publication date from STC. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Mutilated.
Henrie Kyrkeham
Alexander Lacie
the signe of the blacke Boye, at the middle north dore of Paules church
>>>>>>> imprintparse
